covered: Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios (default params, explicit offset/limit, audit=FULL/MINIMAL/none, combinations) verify normal operation.
Empty Response: Scenario for no bundles and offset beyond total covers empty-array responses.
Pagination: Offset/limit behavior is covered (default limit, explicit paging, large dataset slices, offset beyond end, partially populated DB).
Query Parameters: Good coverage of valid and invalid parameter values (negative numbers, invalid audit enum, extra unexpected params, SQL injection attempt, integer boundary cases).
Error Handling / Resilience: Dependency failure (503) and timeout (504) scenarios are included.
Performance: Basic performance/concurrency tests (single-request latency and 50 concurrent requests) are present.
Regression & Backward Compatibility: Tests for backward compatibility (no audit param) and a regression scenario are present.
gaps: Rate Limiting: No tests for rate-limiting/throttling (e.g., many requests in short time to verify 429 handling).
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET semantics (If-None-Match -> 304).
Response Schema & Content-Type: No explicit tests validating the Bundle JSON schema, required fields, types, or Content-Type header (application/json).
Authorization nuance: No tests for 403/authorization-scoped access (roles/permissions) — only missing/invalid token -> 401 is covered.

Exact Status Code Contracts: Several scenarios allow multiple expected codes (400 or 422, 400 or 422, 503 or timeout code) rather than asserting the exact contract; story expects >=400 for errors but schema of exact codes is not assertive.
Rate/Limit edge semantics: No test asserting defaulting behavior when limit is omitted vs explicit limit > default but <= max (clarify max allowed limit behavior and enforcement).
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests that send bursts of requests and verify 429 responses and Retry-After header behavior.
Add caching tests: validate presence and correctness of Cache-Control/ETag/Last-Modified headers, and conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match -> 304).
Add JSON schema validation for Bundle objects: assert required fields, data types, and that the response Content-Type is application/json.
Add authorization/permission tests for 403 cases (valid token but insufficient permissions), and tests covering token expiry/refresh behavior.
Make error-code expectations exact where the API contract defines them (replace “400 or 422” with the single expected code or add a test for the documented mapping).
Add tests for maximum allowed limit behaviour (explicit tests for exact max value and values just above it) and assert error message content/structure.
Include tests that assert pagination-related headers (if used) such as Link, total-count, or next/prev cursors if the API supports them.
